title: Kirchhoff loop - effect of switch on I-B and I-2

content.question:
A circuit is comprised of a battery, four resistors, and a switch that is initially open, as shown in the figure. The currents in the battery and in Resistor are <math alttext="I sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub></math> and <math alttext="I sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, respectively. The switch is then closed. What happens to <math alttext="I sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub></math> and <math alttext="I sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> when the switch is closed?
<math alttext="I sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub></math><math alttext="I sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>AIncreasesIncreasesBIncreasesDecreasesCDecreasesIncreasesDDecreasesDecreases

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
